revision.text: {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WPMILHIST|class=B|Biography=yes | B1 = y | B2 = y | B3 = y | B4 = y | B5 = y |Early-Modern=yes|Napoleonic=yes|Maritime=yes|British=yes}} {{WikiProject UK|class=B|importance=low}} {{WikiProject Biography|living=no|military-work-group=yes|class=B |peerage-work-group=yes|listas=Howe, Richard Howe, 1st Earl|peerage-priority=low}} }} ==Infobox== As Howe was an Admiral, I propose changing the infobox from a Person Infobox (which only contains family info which is in the text anyway) to a Military Person infobox (which contains more military detail). Any views? [[User:Dormskirk|Dormskirk]] ([[User talk:Dormskirk|talk]]) 22:39, 16 December 2007 (UTC) :Military person infobox now used [[User:Dormskirk|Dormskirk]] ([[User talk:Dormskirk|talk]]) 14:25, 12 January 2008 (UTC) == question... == He was on Anson's expedition? I love Patrick O'Brian's [[The Golden Ocean]] and [[The Unknown Shore]], which were based on the journals of surviving individuals from the expedition. Was Howe one of the characters in the novels? [[Jack Byron]] was the protagonist of one of these novels. One of the other characters, a young midshipman, was the god-son of the King. Could that have been Howe? Cheers! [[User:Geo Swan|Geo Swan]] ([[User talk:Geo Swan|talk]]) 02:20, 17 July 2010 (UTC) ==POV== The EB/DNB material in this article is begging to be rewritten. Some events (the events with d'Estaing at New York and Rhode Island, to name but one example) are barely recognizable given the POV language used by those sources. ''[[User:Magicpiano|Magic]]''[[User_talk:Magicpiano|♪piano]] 16:05, 19 February 2013 (UTC) :now re-written. [[User:Dormskirk|Dormskirk]] ([[User talk:Dormskirk|talk]]) 19:55, 19 April 2015 (UTC) ::You may have rewritten parts, but you've not (yet) touched the specific paragraph I complained about, which is just as POV when cited to a different source. Howe is being given too much credit for d'Estaing's caution, a more commonly cited reason for the particular passage of events. See [[Battle of Rhode Island]] for details and sources. (I'm also dubious about the reason given for his resignation, but I haven't been in those sources in some time.) ''[[User:Magicpiano|Magic]]''[[User_talk:Magicpiano|♪piano]] 01:02, 20 April 2015 (UTC) :::Now much toned down. Hope it's OK now. [[User:Dormskirk|Dormskirk]] ([[User talk:Dormskirk|talk]]) 21:07, 20 April 2015 (UTC) ::::It's not as POV, but it's a pretty significant simplification. (This is not necessarily a problem, but a slightly longer treatment might be called for if you're trying to GA this article.) ''[[User:Magicpiano|Magic]]''[[User_talk:Magicpiano|♪piano]] 14:21, 22 April 2015 (UTC) :::::Now expanded a bit. Thanks. [[User:Dormskirk|Dormskirk]] ([[User talk:Dormskirk|talk]]) 10:49, 25 April 2015 (UTC) == date of birth == At top of article is Admiral of the Fleet Richard Howe, 1st Earl Howe, KG (8 March 1726 – 5 August 1799) He was born before 1752, the year England and its colonies changed from old style to new style calendar. — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/128.63.16.20|128.63.16.20]] ([[User talk:128.63.16.20|talk]]) 17:19, 1 April 2014 (UTC)
